arm_group.description: 4 nutrient formulations without active ingredient and variable level of available placebo ingredient
4 nutrient formulations with increasing amount of active ingredient

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess whether food ingredient(s) affect glycemic responses.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject is 18-75 years of age

          -  Subject has a body mass index (BMI) ≥ 20.0 and < 35 kg/m² at screening (visit 1).

          -  Subject has normal fasting serum glucose (<7.0mmol/L capillary corresponding to whole
             blood glucose <6.3mmol/L).

          -  Subject has no health conditions that would prevent him from fulfilling the study
             requirements as judged by the Investigator on the basis of medical history.

          -  Subject understands the study procedures and signs forms providing informed consent
             to participate in the study and authorization for release of relevant protected
             health information to the study investigator.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

primary_outcome.description: Glycemic response calculated from individual glucose measurements upon consumption of control and experimental test food products. The individual glucose measurements will be collected at baseline (prior to consumption of each test food product) and over a 2-hour period following the initiation of consumption of each test food product. The primary outcome is differential treatment-effect on the time-concentration glucose curve over the 2 hours post consumption of each test food product.
primary_outcome.measure: Incremental area under the blood glucose response curve

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of decline in blood glucose, peak blood glucose, peak insulin and adjusted time concentration area for insulin

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
